title: Bus crash leaves 4 dead, 30 injured near Utah national park
text:
A tour bus with 30 passengers crashed near a national park in southern Utah on Friday, killing at least four people, authorities told CBS Salt Lake City affiliate KUTV. The Utah Highway Patrol said 12 to 15 victims suffered "very" critical injuries.

The bus hit a guard rail and rolled over near a highway rest stop about 7 miles from Bryce Canyon National Park. The road has since been closed.

According to KUTV, ambulances and rescue crews were dispatched to the scene. Bryce Canyon is known for its distinctive landscape of narrow red-rock spires and is located about 300 miles south of Salt Lake City.
description: At least 30 people were injured though no further information has been provided about their conditions
